page.title: 14A LINK WITH DOMESDAY 1086 ?
page.content: {A Saxon church at Nursling is named {in the Domesday Book.} Could it have been the site of the present church?. The vestry of the present{Church of St {Boniface} is known to have been built in 1240.The porch area was built in the 1300 together with the rough hewn ladder to the belfry. Today the belfry is reached by a modern ladder placed aganist the old one.Large oak beams support the roof of the Nave and stone brackets which supported the rood _ beam are still visible on either side of the chancel arch.A beam inscribed with the name of the church wardens of 1675 is now set in the south wall.{ {The vestry monument in the West wall {is to Sir Richard Mill 1613 and his {wife Mary.1622.}They lived at Grove Place now a school.Some original 14thC. stone floor tiles are now set into the North Wall of the vestry.
